title: No 10 announces 13 new political life peers during recess
description: Thirteen new life peers have been announced by the Government. Downing Street published the list of political peerages on Friday as MPs were on holiday. The Tories’ eight nominations include Paul Goodman, a former Conservative MP and editor of the influential ConservativeHome website.

title: Teens to be banned from buying energy drinks such as Prime under plan considered by Labour
description: Energy drinks will be banned from being sold to under-16s, under plans being considered by Labour. A clampdown is being looked at because of worries about the impact on children’s health - as well as their education. The drinks can be packed with high ...

title: Labour considering ban on sale of energy drinks to under-16s
description: A ban on the sale of energy drinks to under-16s is being considered by the Labour Party if it wins power, Sky News understands. The proposal has been submitted for the party's election manifesto, amid growing evidence of the health risks to young people ...

title: Labour hints at protecting public sector from pension tax
description: Jeremy Hunt, the chancellor, last year scrapped the £1 million lifetime tax-free limit on pension contributions to stop senior NHS consultants leaving the health service over hug

title: The Times view on election policies: Labour Lite

title: Rishi Sunak earned more than £2.2m last year
description: Rishi Sunak earned more than £2.2 million last year and paid an effective tax rate of 23 per cent, according to official accounts released on Friday. Downing Street published the Prime Minister’s tax return which showed that in total he paid just over £500,000 in UK taxes in 2022-23.

title: I absolutely did not consider resignation over Labour green U-turn, Ed Miliband says
description: We spoke to the Shadow Climate Secretary Ed Miliband, and started by asking him why he had initially pushed for the £28 billion investment plan.

title: Tories and Labour both nominate political columnists to House of Lords
description: The Conservatives and Labour have both nominated political columnists to the House of Lords, as 13 new life peers were announced by the Government. Downing Street published the latest list of political peerages on Friday as MPs were on holiday.

title: Labour U-turn: Scrapping green pledge about ‘being straight’ with voters, Starmer says
description: Sir Keir Starmer insists he scrapped Labour’s £28bn green spending pledge to be straight with voters. With environmental groups, union allies and some of his own MPs expressing disappointment, senior Labour figures have been out presenting a united front as they defend the move.

title: Barrister removed from BA flight by armed cops after cabin crew row given peerage by PM
description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak slipped out the list of new peers on Friday evening that also includes a council leader who bragged about trying to kill moles with a blowtorch

title: ‘Frustrated’ businesses seek staff abroad as Britons abandon work
description: Businesses have become “frustrated” with trying to hire British workers and are increasingly looking abroad to fill vacancies, the National Institute of Economic and Social Research (NIESR) has warned.

title: Pink stunned as fan goes into labour during her Australian show

title: Screaming Katie Price ‘held down like a hostage’ during traumatic birth scenes

title: Sunak paid half a million pounds in tax last year, according to his tax returns
description: Politics Live: Sir Rod Stewart says Labour 'deserve a crack' at power The document shows he paid a tax bill of £508,308 in the financial year 2022-23 - around £75,000 more than what he paid in the previous year. Mr Sunak made nearly £1.8m through ...

title: Brian May backs Carol Vorderman in campaign against the Tories as he issues urgent plea

title: Sir Rod Stewart says Labour 'deserve a crack' at running the country
description: Rock legend and long-time Tory voter Sir Rod Stewart has thrown his weight behind Sir Keir Starmer's leadership as he attacked Boris Johnson as a "lying schoolboy".

title: Rachel Reeves won Shadow Cabinet ‘war’ on £28bn U-turn, insiders say
description: Shadow Chancellor Rachel Reeves won an internal battle at the top of Labour that resulted in Sir Keir Starmer deciding to U-turn on a pledge to spend £28bn on green investment.
